search.noResultsDescription: Try adjusting your search terms or clear the filter to see all configurations

emptyState.title: No Configurations Yet
emptyState.description: Get started by creating your first Claude configuration. You can manage multiple configurations for different use cases.

basicInfo.title: Basic Information
basicInfo.description: Configure the basic details for your Claude instance
basicInfo.name: Configuration Name

apiConfig.title: API Configuration
apiConfig.description: Configure the API endpoint and authentication
apiConfig.baseUrlRequired: Base URL is required for custom configurations
apiConfig.baseUrlInvalid: Invalid URL format (must start with http:// or https://)
apiConfig.apiKeyRequired: API Key is required for custom configurations
apiConfig.securityNoteText: API keys are stored securely and encrypted locally.

modelPermissions.title: Model & Permissions
modelPermissions.description: Configure the model and permission settings
modelPermissions.modelHelpText: Leave empty to use the default model for this configuration
modelPermissions.smallModelHelpText: Model used for quick non-essential tasks (ANTHROPIC_SMALL_FAST_MODEL)
modelPermissions.defaultConfigDescription: Use this as the default configuration when starting Claude
modelPermissions.transformerDescription: Transform API requests to match different provider formats
modelPermissions.transformerHelpText: Auto automatically detects based on the API endpoint domain.
modelPermissions.enabledDescription: Configuration is active and can be used

advanced.title: Advanced Settings
advanced.description: Configure advanced environment variables and settings
advanced.authTokenHelpText: Additional authentication token for Claude Code operations
advanced.authHeaderHelpText: Convenience field for Authorization header (e.g., "Bearer token")
advanced.customHeadersInvalid: Invalid format. Each line must be in format "Header: Value"
advanced.customHeadersHelpText: Additional HTTP headers in format: Header1: Value1\nHeader2: Value2

deleteModal.title: Delete Configuration
deleteModal.confirmMessage: Are you sure you want to delete the configuration "{configName}"?
deleteModal.additionalNote: All associated settings and data will be permanently removed.

settings.title: System Settings
settings.description: Configure advanced features and integrations for Start Claude

proxyServer.title: Proxy Server
proxyServer.description: Configure proxy server and load balancing behavior
proxyServer.enableByDefaultDescription: Automatically start proxy server for multi-endpoint configurations
proxyServer.loadBalancingDescription: Determines how requests are distributed across multiple endpoints

speedFirst.title: Speed First Configuration
speedFirst.responseTimeWindowHelpText: Time window for averaging response times (1-60 minutes)
speedFirst.minSamplesHelpText: Required samples before speed-based routing activates (1-20)
speedFirst.speedTestIntervalHelpText: Frequency of periodic endpoint speed tests (30-3600 seconds)
speedFirst.speedTestMethodHelpText: Technique used to measure endpoint latency and speed

healthCheck.title: Endpoint Health Checks
healthCheck.healthCheckIntervalHelpText: Frequency of periodic endpoint health verification (10-300 seconds)
healthCheck.failedEndpointBanDurationHelpText: Time to exclude failed endpoints before retry (60-3600 seconds)

cloudSync.title: Cloud Storage Sync
cloudSync.description: Sync configurations across devices using iCloud, OneDrive, or custom folder
cloudSync.infoDescription: Automatically sync your configurations across multiple devices using cloud storage. Choose your preferred provider below.
cloudSync.customFolderHelpText: Use a custom directory for syncing (e.g., a network drive or manually synced folder)
cloudSync.migrateDescription: Switch from {provider} to another cloud provider

s3Sync.title: S3 Cloud Sync
s3Sync.description: Sync configurations across devices using AWS S3 or compatible storage
s3Sync.s3ObjectKeyHelpText: The path within your S3 bucket where config will be stored
s3Sync.customEndpointHelpText: Leave empty for AWS S3. Use for Cloudflare R2, MinIO, etc.
s3Sync.securityNote: Credentials are stored locally and never transmitted except to your S3 endpoint.
s3Sync.checkIntervalHelpText: How often to check for remote configuration updates (5-1440 minutes)

conflict.title: Configuration Conflict Detected
conflict.description: Both local and cloud storage contain configuration files. Choose how to proceed.
conflict.resolveDescription: Choose how to resolve the differences.

toast.configSetDefault: Configuration "{configName}" has been set as the default.
